metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14387 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in rsync in versions since 3.2.0pre1. Rsync improperlyvalidates certificate with host mismatch vulnerability. A remote,unauthenticated attacker could exploit the flaw by performing aman-in-the-middle attack using a valid certificate for another hostnamewhich could compromise confidentiality and integrity of data transmittedusing rsync-ssl. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality and integrity. This flaw affects rsync versions before3.2.4.

criterions.comment: rsync: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
